Videos








Videos












































Featured Video
 

How to Apply to UC Riverside
Follow along as UCR students walk you through the process of filling out an admission application.


















Video Quick Links


Admission Presentations

Get to Know UCR

Student Experience

Students Explore Riverside












You have a unique story — so does UC Riverside! Check out our videos to learn what life is like as a UCR Highlander.
Experience our campus, learn about award-winning faculty (including two Nobel Laureates), meet current students, and find out about student success resources. You'll also get guidance on the admission process and learn about vibrant Riverside — a progressive city that’s central to everything that makes Southern California a magical place to live, play, and study!




























































Admission Presentations

























 

First Year: UC Application Workshop
Find out what steps to take to help you shine on the University of California application for fall 2023.






















First Year: General Admission Presentation
Join first-year admission counselor, Cesar, to learn about UCR’s campus, student life, and general admission requirements.





















 

Transfer: Presenting Yourself on the UC Application
Find out what steps to take to help you shine on the University of California transfer application for fall 2023.

























 

UC Riverside Transfer Admissions
Join transfer admission counselor, Diana, for an overview of the University of California, Riverside (UCR), including admission information, majors, and student success resources.























Get to Know UCR























 

UC Riverside: Bold Hearts. Brilliant Minds.
Powered by a great education, world-leading research, and knowledge-driven impact, you’ll transform the nation and the world.





















 

UC Riverside Continues Climbing the Rankings
UCR is recognized for inclusion, innovation, student success, value, and social mobility.





















 

UCR: Unique. Committed. Real.
Get a world-class education, enjoy year-round fun in Riverside, and explore Southern California from our central location.

























 

Fall in LOVE With UCR
Study among friends, get real-life experience, and live in 277 days of sunshine.





















 

Student-Led UCR Campus Tour
Join student tour guide, Juan, for a virtual tour of UC Riverside and discover fun facts about academics, facilities, and campus life.














 
UC Riverside Campus Dining Tour
Discover the best places to dine on campus, such as The Habit, Starbucks, food trucks, and convenience stores. 

















UC Riverside Housing Tour
Tour UCR’s student housing communities and get a feel for exciting amenities. (Off-campus living options included.)



















 

UCR: You’ll Love Our Resources
Discover success resources such as first-year programs, career-planning services, internships, tutoring, and financial aid.





















 

UCR: You’ll Love Our Faculty
Reach your goals with help from award-winning faculty, including two Nobel Laureates, industry experts, and community leaders.




















 


Student Experience























 

UCR: You'll Love the Student Experience
Find out what makes our student experience so unique.





















 

UCR: Out-of-State Testimonial Video
Learn what out-of-state students have to say about their UCR experience.






















 

UCR: International Testimonial Video
Learn what international students have to say about their UCR experience.
























 

Why Transfer to UCR?
Transfer students share how UCR has helped them succeed.





















 

Blue, Gold & Black Podcast Trailer
Check out the new podcast dedicated to amplifying Black voices at UCR through conversations with Black campus leaders and faculty members.





















 

Current International Student Testimonials
Hear from students representing France, Indonesia, Italy, Malaysia, Panama, and Singapore — just some of the 88+ countries represented at UCR.




















Out-of-State Student Stories




















From Texas to UCR: Meet Erica
Find out how this Texas-raised and California-educated Highlander gets around campus, sneaks naps, and finds freebies at UCR.















From Florida to UCR: Meet Jackie
Find out where this Florida-raised and California-educated Highlander finds free citrus, zones out, and gets inspired at UCR.















From Washington to UCR: Meet Leah
Find out where this Washington-raised and California-educated Highlander studies, relaxes, and fills food cravings at UCR.


















Students Explore Riverside























 

Happy Festival of Colors From UCR
UCR joins the Riverside community in sharing well wishes for a bright and colorful season.





















 

UCR at Riverside’s Dickens Festival
UCR students enjoy the Riverside’s annual Dickens Festival.





















 

UCR Students Celebrate Riverside's Festival of Lights
The Mission Inn Festival of Lights is just one of Riverside’s many cultural events.

























 

Happy Lunar New Year from UC Riverside!
UCR students celebrate the new year with wishes for good luck, good health, blessings, and prosperity.















Riverside: Things to Do, See and Experience
Explore Riverside, California, a historical city known for arts and innovation, culture, entertainment, festivals, and nightlife.












 


















 
 
CONNECT WITH UCR

Disclaimer
This information is accurate and reliable at time of posting but may change without notice. Please contact Undergraduate Admissions for the most up-to-date information. Learn about our privacy policy.
Campus Security and Fire Safety Report
The Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act (Clery Act) requires UCR (as an institution of higher education receiving federal financial aid) to report specified crime statistics on college campuses and to provide other safety and crime information to all current and prospective students and employees. The Annual Security and Fire Safety Report is available on the Chief Compliance Office website. If you would like a paper copy of the Report, you may contact the Clery Coordinator via email at clery@ucr.edu or by phone at (951) 827-6223.
